content:
• Tuesday, December 5, 2017
  • GBTC

    New Fed nominee no fan of paper money; Bitcoin pushes through $12K, $13K, $14K

    • “Is Marvin Goodfriend the Worst Fed Nominee of All Time," goes the title of a post on the website of the Mises Institute.
    • Goodfriend has shown more than an academic interest in eliminating currency, arguing the existence of cash makes it difficult for the Fed to impose negative interest rates. In a paper he presented at Jackson Hole last year, Goodfriend suggested abolishing currency as a way to force consumers to keep money in banks (at negative rates).
    • If that doesn't work, he says, consider interest rates of negative 10% not just cutting the value of $1 on deposit to $0.90, but also cutting the value of a $1 bill in your pocket to $0.90.
    • Not enough? How about "currency cards" which represent money straight from the central bank, from which the Fed could electronically control its value.
    • Bitcoin this evening has blasted through $12K for the first time, now up more than 5% on the session to $12,272. Coincidence?
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF
    • Update at 3:00 ET: Now higher by 12% for the session, Bitcoin has topped $13K as well.
    • Update at 8:45 ET: The surge has continued, with Bitcoin now north of $14K.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 PM | 92 Comments
  • TROX

    Tronox -10% as FTC challenges proposed merger with Cristal

    • Tronox (NYSE:TROX) -9.9% after-hours as the Federal Trade Commission issues an administrative complaint challenging its proposed acquisition of competitor Cristal, which would combine two of the top three U.S. suppliers of chloride process titanium dioxide.
    • The FTC alleges that the acquisition would allow the newly merged firm and the other top supplier, Chemours (NYSE:CC), to control the vast majority of chloride titanium dioxide sales in the North American market and more than 80% of North American chloride titanium dioxide manufacturing capacity.
    • The FTC says an administrative trial will begin on May 8, 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • AET

    WSJ: Outgoing Aetna CEO Bertolini set to reap ~$500M if CVS deal closes

    • Aetna (NYSE:AET) CEO Mark Bertolini could pocket ~$500M when he leaves the company if it successfully merges with CVS Health, WSJ reports.
    • Most of Bertolini’s anticipated payout is tied to stock or rights he already held that jump in value with the deal; at the $207/share deal price, more than $230M is expected to come from already vested stock appreciation rights he holds for AET shares, and common shares he currently owns would be valued at ~$190M at the deal price.
    • Some of the payout will be in CVS shares - which, of course, can fluctuate - because the acquisition was structured as 70% in cash and 30% in stock.
    • Another $60M-$85M of the estimated payout is tied to Bertolini’s change-in-control package, which is triggered if he is terminated when the company sells itself.
    • Bertolini will not have an executive role at CVS-Aetna, but he will have a seat on its board of directors; CVS CEO Larry Merlo will run the combined company.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 21 Comments
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment +19% after posting unexpected quarterly profit

    • AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) +19.3% after-hours as it handily beats FQ2 earnings and revenue estimates and reaffirms FY 2018 guidance.
    • FQ2 revenues rose 47% Y/Y to $73.8M, mostly the result of a $23.2M increase in sales from its unmanned aircraft systems segment; gross margin of $31M was 78% higher than in the year-ago quarter.
    • AVAV says orders for products and customer-funded R&D programs boosted its funded backlog to $127M, a 49% increase over the prior quarter, "significantly increasing our revenue visibility for the current fiscal year."
    • For the full year, AVAV sees EPS of $0.45-$0.65 vs. $0.61 analyst consensus estimate on revenues of $280M-$300M vs. $294M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: AVAV +18.1%. FNKO +8.0%. PLAY +7.0%. GLBL +3.7%. PZZA +3.9%.

    Revance readies $175M equity offering

    • Revance Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RVNC) launches a $175M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 4 Comments
  • SNAP

    Snap slips after hours as Evercore gives bearish initiation

    • Shares in Snap (NYSE:SNAP), which peeled off a 10% gain today after a boost to Overweight at Barclays, have fallen back 1.5% after hours as Evercore ISI goes more bearish.
    • The firm has started Snap at Underperform and given it a low price target of $7 -- 53% downside from today's close.
    • Most analysts are Neutral-equivalent on the company as it tries to compete with Facebook on ad products.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 55 Comments
  • VKTX

    Viking Therapeutics initiates equity offering

    • Viking Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VKTX) launches a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Update: Shares are up 23% premarket on robust volume on Wednesday, December 6.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 10 Comments
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett to merge with Fifth Creek Energy, launch 21M-share offering

    • Bill Barrett (BBG) -8.9% after-hours as it announces a merger with Fifth Creek Energy Co. in a deal valued at $649M, creating an E&P company focused on oil-weighted rural areas in Colorado's DJ Basin.
    • BBG and Fifth Creek each will become subsidiaries of a newly formed, publicly listed holding company; BBG stockholders will exchange their shares for the new company's stock on a one-for-one basis, and Fifth Creek's current sole owner will receive 100M shares of the new stock.
    • BBG says initial 2018 plans include operation of three drilling rigs on the combined acreage with anticipated 2018 production of 11M-12M boe (~65% oil) and capex of $500M-$600M.
    • Also, BBG says it will commence a public offering of 21M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to another 3.15M shares.
    • BBG plans to use the proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes, including to finance future capital expenditures.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 14 Comments
  • EDIT

    Editas Medicine launches equity offering

    • Editas Medicine (NASDAQ:EDIT) initiates a $50M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 14 Comments
  • GWPH

    GW Pharma readies equity offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • GW Pharmaceuticals plc (NASDAQ:GWPH) launches a public offering of $225M in American Depositary Shares (ADSs). Price, volume and terms have yet to be released. Shares are down 4% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 6 Comments
  • VNET

    China's 21Vianet Group -4.4% as losses widen on impairments

    • Data center service provider 21Vianet Group's (NASDAQ:VNET) ADS are off 4.4% after hours after Q3 earnings featured revenues that slipped 9% as the company disposed of its managed network services business.
    • The divestiture of MNS is a "milestone development, which will enable us to re-focus on our IDC business and strengthen our core competitive power," says CEO Steve Zhang.
    • Gross profit was up 1.6% Y/Y, to 189.8M yuan (about $28.5M), and gross margin expanded to 21.4% from a year-ago 19.3%.
    • EBITDA nearly doubled to 135M yuan, about $20.3M, and EBITDA margin rose to 15.2% from 7%. Meanwhile, net loss swelled to 1.48B yuan (about $222.3M) from a year-ago 171.5M yuan, mainly due to impairments of long-lived assets and goodwill (excluding those, net loss was 130.8M yuan).
    • Monthly recurring revenues per cabinet rose to 8,571 yuan from 8,311; total cabinets under management increased to 27,424 from last quarter's 27,361. Utilization rate was 74.4% (down from last quarter's 75.2%) and hosting churn rate rose to 0.97% from last quarter's 0.24%.
    • Revenue breakout: Hosting and related services, 759.3M yuan (up 8.7%); Managed network services, 126.8M yuan (down 53%).
    • With its MNS business divested, the company's only guiding for its hosting and related services business, where it forecasts Q4 revenues of 740M-760M yuan vs. a year-ago 703.2M yuan. EBITDA for the business is forecast at 160M-170M yuan, vs. a year-ago 129.7M yuan.
    • Conference call to come at 8 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment beats by $0.35, beats on revenue

    • AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): Q2 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.35.

  • VNOM

    Viper Energy Partners, poised for Permian growth, upgraded to Buy at UBS

    • Viper Energy Partners (VNOM +1.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $27 price target, raised from $19, at UBS, which believes VNOM is well positioned for growth through higher oil and gas production in the Permian Basin with 22 active rigs on its acreage, up from 18 in Q2.
    • The energy team at UBS increases its production estimates for VNOM by a respective 5% and 6% for 2018 and 2019 as it raises its 2018 and 2019 crude price forecast by a respective 6% and 2%.
    • As a result, UBS hikes its distribution growth expectations for VNOM and now expects a 2017-21 DPU compound annual growth rate of 17% (without additional acquisitions), up from 6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar +7% as it unveils first functional Series 6 module, 2018 guidance

    • First Solar (FSLR +6.8%) surges after unveiling the first functional Series 6 thin film photovoltaic module produced at the company’s Perrysburg, Ohio, facility and FY 2018 financial guidance.
    • FSLR tells its Analyst Day event that it expects Series 6 will enter the commercial market with a power rating of 420-445 watts and conversion efficiency of more than 17%, provide more watts per lift than comparable crystalline silicon solar panels, and can be installed on virtually any ground-based PV mounting system.
    • FSLR says it is expanding its production facility in Vietnam, essentially doubling production capacity of the initial site, which is still under construction; when fully operational, annualized production capacity in Vietnam will total 2.4 GW - when combined with Perrysburg and facilities in Malaysia, FSLR says its Series 6 manufacturing capacity will total ~5.4 GW by 2020.
    • The company also announces two module supply agreements (I, II) totaling nearly 800 MW with D. E. Shaw Renewable Investments and Origis Energy USA.
    • In its financial guidance, FSLR sees FY 2018 GAAP EPS of $1.25-$1.75 vs $1.22 analyst consensus estimate and revenues of $2.3B-$2.5B vs $2.39B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 28 Comments
  • MSFT

    Microsoft unveils laptops featuring Qualcomm chips

    • Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) shows off new laptops built by Asus and HP with Qualcomm’s (NASDAQ:QCOM) ARM-based Snapdragon 835 chips.
    • Windows PCs have traditionally used Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) chips and Intel is watching closely to see if the Qualcomm chip inclusion violates its IP rights. 
    • Microsoft’s last go with an ARM-based PC came in 2012 with the first-gen Surface tablets, which led to a $900M write-down the following year. 
    • Qualcomm needs partnerships as its legal battles with Apple continue and could lead to the end of that supplier agreement. 
    • Microsoft shares are up 1%. 
    • Qualcomm shares are up 0.4%.   
    • Intel shares are down 2.4%.           
    • Previously: Apple could drop Qualcomm components (Oct. 31)
    • Previously: Fast Company: Apple and Intel working together on 5G modem (Nov. 17)
    • Previously: Intel warns Qualcomm, Microsoft on x86 architecture emulation (June 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 80 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: DPW +10%. JRJC +10%. VHC +10%. BITA +9%. SNAP +9%.

  • RVNC

    Allergan plays down Revance data

    • The response rates for Revance's (RVNC +36.3%) Phase 3 study of RT-002 were similar or worse than the Phase 2b study, Allergan (AGN -1.4%) tells Bloomberg.
    • "At 6 months, the response rate by physician assessment was only 29%-35%, and the response rate by patient assessment was only 22% at 6 months," says the company. Turning that around means nearly 80% of RT-002 patients did not feel they had maintained a response at six months.
    • "We do not believe this data will support a longer duration claim."
    • Previously: Allergan under modest pressure on potential encroachment of Revance on Botox franchise; shares down 2% premarket (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 6 Comments
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes credit rating cut at S&P

    • Baker Hughes' (BHGE -1.6%) credit rating is downgraded to A- from A+ at Standard & Poor's, reflecting the credit agency's revision of BHGE's group status to non-strategic from highly strategic following GE's reassessment that it could look to exit its ownership in the company.
    • The outlook is stable, reflecting S&P's expectation that BHGE will continue to achieve operating synergies from the merger with GE Oil & Gas, projected to be up to $1.6B by 2020.
    • S&P expects BHGE to benefit from a recovery in North American onshore markets at least over the next few years, which should offset weaker markets in the offshore and LNG markets until 2020 or later.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • GBTC

    Bitcoin Investment Trust premium narrows

    • Bitcoin is having a relatively quiet day - currently unchanged - but not so for Bitcoin Investment Trust (OTCQX:GBTC). A plunge earlier this session narrowed the premium to the value of its Bitcoin holdings to about 40% from 80%.
    • The stock has since bounced, but still remains lower by 10.5% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 136 Comments
  • VTGN

    VistaGen nabs U.S. patent covering methods of synthesizing compounds; shares ahead 28%

    • Thinly traded nano cap VistaGen Therapeutics (VTGN +28.2%) jumps on lower-than-normal volume in apparent response to the issuance of a new U.S. patent (No. 9,834,801) covering methods of synthesizing compounds, including chiral kynurenines.

  • ADMP

    Adamis up 26% on IND filing for opioid overdose drug naloxone with Symject syringe

    • Adamis Pharmaceuticals (ADMP +26.2%) is up on almost double normal volume in response to its IND filing for opioid overdose antidote naloxone administered via the same patented Symject syringe delivery platform as emergency allergic reaction med Symjepi (epinephrine).
    • Clinical testing can start after the FDA approves the IND.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 31 Comments
  • NSPR

    InspireMD's CGuard EPS shows durable effect in study

    • A clinical study, PARADIGM 101, evaluating the long-term effect of InspireMD's (NSPR -5.6%) CGuard embolic prevention system (EPS) showed a sustained treatment benefit. The results were presented at the ICI Meeting in Tel Aviv.
    • At 24 months of follow-up, no major adverse cardiac events (heart attack, stroke, death) occurred related to the placement of the stent.
    • Investors appear unmoved. Shares have sold off ~66% since last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • WDC

    Nikkei: Toshiba execs meeting to settle Western Digital dispute

    • Toshiba execs will meet Wednesday to discuss settling with Western Digital (NYSE:WDC), according to Nikkei Asian Review.
    • The execs will discuss the “sticking points” that have prevented a resolution and the sale of Toshiba’s chip unit. 
    • Western Digital reportedly wants assurance that South Korean-based SK Hynix, a member of the buying consortium, won’t have access to tech data from Toshiba Memory.
    • Western Digital is also worried about Bain, the consortium leader, and its desire to “retain the option” to sell Toshiba Memory to rivals like Samsung.     
    • Western Digital shares are up 1.5%.    
    • Previously: Toshiba, Western Digital close to settling dispute (Dec. 1)
    • Previously: Toshiba will sell most of its stake in chipmaker (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 8 Comments
  • CPRI

    Goldman Sachs positive on Michael Kors

    • Michael Kors (KORS +1.9%) trades higher after Goldman Sachs resumes coverage with a Buy rating.
    • Analyst Lindsay Drucker points to improving handbag trends and think synergies from the Jimmy Choo acquisition will accelerate.
    • GS assigns a price target of $70 to KORS.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 14 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Losers: GROW -7%. JTPY -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • FCX

    Copper price plunges amid rising inventories

    • Copper prices sink to their lowest level in more than two months, as some investors take profits following data showed an inflow into LME warehouses.
    • Comex copper for March delivery currently -4.4% at $2.952/lb. after falling below $3/lb. for the first time since early October and down more than 7% from three-year highs also reached last month.
    • After surging in response to strong Chinese economic data earlier this year, some investors now worry that a slowdown in China - which accounts for ~50% of the world’s copper consumption - could weigh on prices moving forward, and has prompted some speculators to take chips off the table, says Jefferies analyst Christopher LaFemina.
    • A stronger dollar also is weighing on prices by making copper and other dollar-denominated commodities more expensive for overseas buyers.
    • Among big metals producers: FCX -2.2%, RIO -2%, BHP -1.4%, VALE -1.2%, SCCO -2.1%, TECK -3.6%.
    • ETFs: JJC, CPER, CUPM
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 11 Comments
  • RDHL

    RedHill to part ways with IntelGenx on development of migraine med Rizaport

    • Citing its increasing focus on the GI space, RedHill Biopharma (RDHL -1.6%) informs RIZAPORT (RHB-103) partner IntelGenx (OTCQX:IGXT -4.3%) that it will terminate their co-development and commercialization agreement effective January 6, 2018. The companies announced the resubmission of the U.S. marketing application on November 1 but it appears the FDA issued either a CRL or Refusal-to-File letter in response. RedHill received the first CRL in March 2013.
    • In a update to investors, the company expects the following key events in 2018:
    • Topline results from the Phase 3 study of RHB-104 in Crohn's (mid-year).
    • Topline data from the Phase 3 study of TALICIA (RHB-105) in H. pylori infection  (second half).
    • Initiation of Phase 3 study of RHB-104 in nontuberculous mycobacteria infections (first half).
    • Initiation of Phase 2a study of YELIVA (ABC294640) in bile duct cancer (early January).
    • Previously: RedHill up 2% premarket on refiling of U.S. marketing application for Rizaport for migraine (Nov. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 10 Comments
  • COUP

    Barclays comments on Coupa Software's earnings report

    • Barclays says Coupa Software’s (NASDAQ:COUP) earnings report yesterday showed healthy growth but that FY19 could have moving parts due to a shorter Q1 and adoption impact of 606.
    • Firm thinks Coupa currently has a high valuation. 
    • Barclays reiterates its Equal Weight rating and $38 price target.    
    • Coupa shares are up 1.7%.    
    • Previously: Coupa Software beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Dec. 4)
    • Previously: Coupa Software -3.3% despite Q3 beats, upside guidance (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM

  • AMOT

    Alied Motion Technologies announces $65M award

    • Alied Motion Technologies (NASDAQ:AMOT) receives a $65M award to provide solutions for the company’s Vehicle market in Asia and Europe
    • Revenue for the application will ramp up in 2021 and mostly complete by 2028.
    • Alied Motion previously announced a $90M award for the Vehicle market.
    • The new award brings this year’s total $155M and the seven-year average to $22.1M per year. 
    • Alied Motion Technologies shares are up 1.9%.  
    • Previously: Allied Motion Technologies beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Nov. 1)
    • Previously: Allied Motion Technologies declares $0.025 dividend (Nov. 1)

  • SSNI

    Itron commences $300M senior note offering, clears antitrust review

    • Itron (ITRI) announces the commencement of a $300M private offering of senior notes due 2025.
    • The offering is part of the financing for the acquisition of Silver Spring Networks (NYSE:SSNI) and the following merger. 
    • Itron and Silver Springs also report that the acquisition has cleared antitrust review in the U.S. The companies expect the deal to close early next year.   
    • Itron shares are up 1.4%. 
    • Silver Springs shares are up 1.1%.       
    • Previously: Canaccord Genuity downgrades Itron on Silver Spring purchase (Sept. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • SFS

    Jittery trading on Smart & Final Stores

    • Smart & Final Stores (SFS -6.8%) tracks lower after JPMorgan issues a cautious outlook on the grocery store operator.
    • The firm expects S&F to face increased competition in California and points to a higher cost structure due to the Haggen acquisition. Naturally, the threat of Amazon is added to the mix by JP.
    • Shares are rated at Neutral and assigned a price target of $9.
    • Sources: CNBC and Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • HUBS

    HubSpot down after Citron Research report

    • HubSpot (NYSE:HUBS) has a rough morning as Citron Research releases a report on the company.
    • Citron sees HubSpot shares dropping to $50 soon and to $25 in the long-term due to the fundamentals. 
    • Citron’s Andrew Left will appear on Bloomberg Markets TV at 2:15 EST today to talk about the HubSpot report so expect more volatility later in the day. 
    • HubSpot shares are down 1.7%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 2 Comments

  • BIOC

    Biocept nabs U.S. patent covering "switch-blocker" technology; shares ahead 13%

    • The USPTO issues U.S. Patent No. 9,834,817 to Biocept (BIOC +12.5%) covering methods of detecting nucleic acid sequence variants which it says encompasses its proprietary "switch-blocker" technology, designed to improve oncogene detection rates.
    • The '817 patent applies to a broad range of molecular diagnostic platforms, including digital PCR, real-time PCR, Sanger sequencing, next-gen sequencing, arrays, mass spectrometry and capillary detection systems.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 5 Comments
  • FDS

    Northcoast downgrades FactSet Research Systems

    • Northcoast downgrades FactSet Research Systems (NYSE:FDS) from Buy to Neutral.
    • Latest analyst recommendations (via FT): 1 Buy, 1 Outperform, 12 Hold, 2 Underperform, and 1 Sell. 
    • Median price target: $176. 
    • FactSet shares are down 1.5%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • WIN

    Windstream -6.8% after consent solicitation update

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) is down 6.8% after the latest update on long-running consent solicitations on its senior debt -- moves to waive alleged defaults tied to the spin-off of Uniti Group (UNIT +0.4%).
    • With an expiration date passing last night, the company says it's received consents from holders representing a majority of outstanding principal on 7.75% senior notes due 2021 and 7.5% senior notes due 2022.
    • "The company has now received waivers and consents with respect to all series of the company’s previously outstanding senior notes relating to alleged defaults with respect to the spin-off," Windstream says. "Holders of over 90% of the outstanding aggregate principal amount of the company’s notes delivered waivers and consents in the consent solicitations."
    • Previously: Windstream CFO confident about default face-off with Aurelius (Nov. 29 2017)
    • Previously: Windstream -2.5% as it launches latest effort to waive alleged default (Nov. 28 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 331 Comments
  • LXFT

    Pivotal Research initiates Luxoft, EPAM

    • Pivotal Research initiates coverage on Luxoft Holding (NYSE:LXFT) with a Buy rating and $70 price target.
    • The firm also initiates EPAM Systems (NYSE:EPAM) at Buy with a $120 price target.
    • Pivotal calls EPAM a market leader with excellent and consistent results and considers Luxoft a turnaround play with more risk and the chance for greater reward. 
    • Valuations: EPAM shares trading at 23x 2018 estimates and Luxoft at 14.5x CY18 estimates, which represents an almost 40% discount.   
    • Luxoft shares are up 2.4%.
    • EPAM shares are up 1.2%.       
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • CUR

    Neuralstem's lead candidate NSI-189 shows potential efficacy in MDD at 40 mg dose; shares ahead 67%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Neuralstem (CUR +67%) jumps on a whopping 55x surge in volume in response to new data on lead candidate NSI-189 in major depressive disorder (MDD). The results were presented at the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology Annual Meeting in Palm Springs, CA.
    • Patients receiving the 40 mg dose experienced statistically significant improvements in MDD symptoms as measured by scales called SDQ and CPFQ. There was also a statistically greater reduction in scores of another metric called QIDS-SR versus placebo in Stage 2 of the study.
    • The 80 mg dose failed to beat placebo.
    • The company intends to meet with the FDA in H1 2018 to discuss the results and a regulatory path to approval. It also plans to submit the data for publication.
    • The company says small molecule NSI-189, a benzylpiperazine-aminopyridine, stimulates neurogenesis, synaptogenesis and increases hippocampal volume, all of which play a role in reversing depression, enhancing cognition and promoting the growth of new nerve tissue.
    • Previously: Neuralstem's NSI-189 flunks mid-stage study in MDD; shares plummet 61% premarket (July 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 16 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: CUR +70%. RVNC +33%. MBRX +17%. COLL +14%. AKTX +11%.
    • Losers: GALT -35%. SNSS -10%. HRTX -10%. ROKA -8%. FCSC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras signs $5B financing deal with China Development Bank

    • Petrobras (PBR +1.7%) says it signed a deal with China Development Bank for $5M in financing through 2027.
    • The Brazilian company says half the loan will be disbursed this month and the rest in January, when it will pay the remaining $2.8B it owes to the Chinese bank on a 2009 loan.
    • PBR also says it signed a contract with Unipec Asia Co. for the preferential supply of 100K boe/day for 10 years.

  • ZYME

    Zymeworks' lead candidate shows positive action in early-stage study; shares up 1%

    • Preliminary results from a Phase 1 dose-escalation study evaluating Zymeworks' (ZYME +1%) lead candidate ZW25 in patients with HER2-expressing cancers showed a treatment effect. The data will be presented on Friday, December 8 at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium.
    • A total of 22 patients are enrolled, 11 with breast cancer, eight with gastric, gastroesophageal junction or esophageal (GE) cancer and three with other HER2-expressing cancers.
    • The partial response rate was 27% (n=6/22) across all dose groups. In breast cancer patients who received a median of six prior lines of HER2-targeted therapy, the partial response rate was 56% (n=5/9) in those with measurable disease with 89% (n=8/9) showing decreases in target lesions.
    • Three HER2-high GE cancer patients with measurable disease showed tumor shrinkage, including one partial responder and one with stable disease after six months.
    • 79% (n=11/14) of breast and GE cancer patients with measurable disease experienced decreases in target lesions.
    • On the safety front, ZW25 was well-tolerated with all adverse events (AEs) considered mild or moderate. The most frequent AEs were diarrhea, infusion reactions and nausea.
    • Enrollment is underway in the second part of the trial evaluating a regimen of 20 mg/kg of ZW25 every other week in four expansion cohorts in HER2-high cancers.
    • ZW25 is a bispecific antibody that can simultaneously bind to two non-overlapping epitopes of HER2, thereby increasing binding and removal of HER2 protein from the cell surface and boosting efficacy.
    • Update: Shares are up 11% on modestly higher volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM

    • Shire plc (SHPG +1%) inks a collaboration agreement with Rani Therapeutics to explore the use of the latter's Rani Pill Technology for the oral delivery of factor VIII therapy for hemophilia A patients. Shire will have the exclusive option for a license to develop and commercialize the technology for the indication after feasibility studies are completed.
    • The Rani Pill enables the delivery of large molecules without exposing the drugs to digestive enzymes. Once ingested, the capsule delivers the payload via an injection into the small intestine.   • GALT

    Galectin's GR-MD-02 shows treatment benefit in subset of NASH patients in mid-stage study; shares ahead 27% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Galectin Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GALT) is up 27% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement of results from a Phase 2b clinical trial, NASH-CX, evaluating lead candidate GR-MD-02 in NASH cirrhosis patients with portal hypertension.
    • The study failed to achieve the primary endpoint of a statistically valid reduction in hepatic venous pressure gradient (HVPG) compared to placebo in all subjects.
    • In a subset (50%) of participants, those without esophageal varices (dilated veins in the esophagus due to the pressure from portal hypertension), showed a statistically significant improvement in HVPG versus placebo.
    • There were also statistically significant effects on improving hepatocyte ballooning (liver cell death) and reducing the development of new esophageal varices in patients without varices at baseline.
    • In terms of absolute reductions in HVPG from baseline, there was a statistically significant greater proportion of responders without varices compared to placebo.
    • The company intends to advance the program into Phase 3 development.
    • Update: Shares are down 46% premarket on resumption of trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 7 Comments
